titleStmt.title: Newes from France. Being a true copy of a letter sent from Mounsieur Du Plesis Cardinall Richlieu, Cardinall of France, to the Queen, concerning many matters of great note, and high consequence. Faithfully translated out of French into English, by Richard Jackson. Together with His Majesties second message to the Parliament, concerning Sir Iohn Hothams refusall to give His Majestie entrance into his town of Hull. April 28. MDCXLII.
titleStmt.author: Richelieu, Armand Jean du Plessis, duc de, 1585-1642.

titleStmt.title: Newes from France. Being a true copy of a letter sent from Mounsieur Du Plesis Cardinall Richlieu, Cardinall of France, to the Queen, concerning many matters of great note, and high consequence. Faithfully translated out of French into English, by Richard Jackson. Together with His Majesties second message to the Parliament, concerning Sir Iohn Hothams refusall to give His Majestie entrance into his town of Hull. April 28. MDCXLII.
titleStmt.author: Richelieu, Armand Jean du Plessis, duc de, 1585-1642.
Jackson, Richard, 1620 or 21-1671.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). aut

notesStmt.note: Charles I's message to Parliament was delivered 30 April 1645.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
